Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from anywhere can pick up their spatula for debate and comment publicly on any topic of their liking — and The Dutch — a tightly knit society where one must be related by blood, word or deed before being qualified to develop a concurred opinion without first having gone through a rigorous vaccination program of insult

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Universal’s delightful red-yellow-green Optimax panoramic subtitles. I enjoyed seeing some early 19th century New Zealand history dramatised on screen, but the film was essentially an elaborate, training exercise for the most famous fan of military hardware in history, Oliver Reed.
